So, funny story about how that one happened. 

When we started development and naming on Neeko, all the regions we localize into had no real problems with that name. Now, champions take anywhere from 8-14 months to go from our discovery phase (where we brainstorm) to launch. 

Neeko had an 8 month development cycle. During that time, we ADDED countries to our localization list. In fact, it was super close to PBE when we added Arabic support. Our team immediately flagged the name, but since changing her name so late in the game would cause lots of delays, we opted to keep as is and empower our team to change/edit the name as they saw fit in their language. It's not an ideal solve, I'll admit, but it was definitely a rare case. 

Now we have added more regions to our sensitivity checks to ensure that this doesn't happen again, as we'd love for all our names to have parity.

I almost do it in the opposite direction half the time - I come up with *one* ability (it doesn't have to be an ultimate) that I want to sort of define my concept, and then I try to find a theme that would fit that ability. For example, my [latest concept](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/plXbM055-champion-concept-fluvis-guru-of-geysers) was based primarily around his Q - I wanted to make a champion that used geysers. After looking into geysers, I came up with the revelation that geysers never react *exactly* the same way every time. Instead, their eruptions depend on the amount of generated pressure, with always fluctuates. So I then came up with his passive and changed his kit to have varying effects depending on the amount of damage he took between his spellcasts. I also came up with his ult as a way of both charging pressure, and unleashing pressure very suddenly, and changed his Q to realistically have varying degrees of strength. At this point, I realized I was essentially making him an AP-based tank/juggernaut, so I filled in my remaining blank by giving him pretty much a Gragas E for an engage/escape, and my buddy Nasu brought up that he was lacking a good defensive spell to cast, so I added the effect of a shield to his E to augment its usage. His name came last, from a "mystic" website that suggested fantasy names based around water. tbh...this concept is sort of a poor example for name-making, as I probably put the least amount of effort into it.

In your case it's a bit different, as it seems you want to simply start with the theme of an owl-person assassin and go from there. Since you want to make an owlman, you can always look into what owls associate with to some cultures. For example, in Egypt the owl represents death - specifically, protection of departed souls to the afterlife. So if you wanted to make an owlman assassin, you probably wouldn't want to try and fit the theme of a protector, and you can cross that off. But in Greece and Rome, owls end up referring to the goddess Minerva - the goddess of magic, weaving, commerce and well, you get it. In Gaelic, it focuses more on the pagan aspect of "The Crone", which essentially means a powerful, elderly witch. Most all of these though place them, of course, in the night. So when I do all those references, basically I'd come up with "some sort of magic-damage based assassin who can also associate with the night in some manner." and then try to think of names or abilities that would fit that thematic.

There are a lot of ways to go about it, and not everything will fit. Fortunately, you have just as many ways of finding a name as you have chances of finding one that sounds fitting enough.

Leona = Leonine, an animal very associated with the sun.

Caitlyn/Katarina = One of their meanings is "pure"; ironic names. The other meaning is related to Hecate, goddess of witchcraft, which befits such cunning women. Their names are variations on the same original name.

Pantheon = All the gods (Pan "everything" + Theos "god"). Original name Atreus also means "fearless". Both of these could be fitting if, like Riot's hinting, Atreus decides to go all God of War on Targon (which would also be ironic considering the name of the son of that series's protagonist...)

Twisted Fate = His nickname is obvious. But his real name, Tobias Felix, is twofold in being both fitting and ironic. "Tobias" essentially means "God is good", but Tobias himself is anything but someone who would believe in such a statement. His last name, "Felix", is well-known to mean "lucky" in Latin, which of course, fits his and his family's magic. However, it can also mean "happy", which is also ironic.

Ahri = Means beautiful in Korean ("ari"), with an H added in the middle for flair. Back in the day, Riot even had the Korean playerbase choose her name. 

Aurelion Sol = Golden Sun. Can you get more awesome than that?

Cassiopeia = Named after Queen Cassiopeia in Classical Mythology, mother of Andromeda (Perseus's wife). It was her vanity and hubris (claiming to be more beautiful than the Nereids, a bad idea) that caused Andromeda to get tied up to a rock as a sacrifice. And eventually she gets turned to stone by Perseus's Medusa head. League of Legends's Cassiopeia certainly fits the vanity portion, as well as the karmic fate. But ironically, it's *she* who becomes the gorgon who can turn people to stone, instead of having it done to her.
 *Also, her real name apparently means "cassia juice". Uh...make of that what you will.

Brand = Firebrand. Not too hard. 

Fiora = "Flower" in Italian, except with an A at the end instead of an E. I suppose calling her "Fleur" would stray too close to Harry Potter territory. But it certainly fits someone who is supposed to emulate fleur-de-lis era France.

Annie = Grace or Graciousness. Make of that what you will, but she certainly dances gracefully. 

Udyr = "Beast" in Norse. 

Yuumi = You and Me, of course!

P.S. Evelynn's actual name origin is Germanic, but it does mean "desired". Which is exactly what Evelynn makes herself through all her victims, and even her cult. 

I could keep going. I'm big on etymology and name origins, and a lot of League champions have names with traceable ones.

I've done a few champion concepts, and the best thing that works for me is to use a combination of naming tactics.

First I'll decide what just _sounds_ right. Rolls off the tongue and pops in your head. 

Then I take to translators. Translating adjectives to various languages helps to find something more unique. If you can't find fun adjectives, I find Thesaurus.com to be incredibly useful. 

Then I start reworking the name. Mashing translated names, adjusting spelling and pronunciation, swapping letters. Even randomly translating the Frankenstein name to see how it works. 

In the end you get names like **_Atillok_**, which roughly means darkness slayer. It's badass, but has an air of mystical origins to it.

League I feel like has several walls in their office dedicated to various dart boards for Champion ideas

Wall 1 - Letter the name should begin with

Wall 2 - Role Champion should play. Ranged or Physical.

Wall 3 - Region Champion hails from. Skill focused or Auto attack focused.

Wall 4 - Champion ability kit. Passive(s).

Wall 5 - [Unrelated] Delete Yasuo?

Wall 6 - [Unrelated] Who's the next rework?

Wall 7 - [Unrelated] What's for lunch?

Wall 8 - [Unrelated] Heads or Tails?

Wall 9 - [Unrelated] Next patch theme? I.e. Buff or nerf

Wall 10 - Finish Champion idea before leak...or leak even though we've barely started art work?
